com.ssdd.cs.client.senders

Class CriticalSectionRequestSenderPool

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ssdd.cs.client.senders.CriticalSectionRequestSenderPool

  • public class CriticalSectionRequestSenderPool
extends java.lang.Object
    sends in a concurrent way messages to all processes to request the acces to critical section.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    Héctor Sánchez San Blas, Francisco Pinto Santos

    • Method Detail

      • multicastSend

        public void multicastSend(java.lang.String sender,
                          java.util.List<java.lang.String> receivers,
                          CriticalSectionRouter router,
                          long messageTimeStamp)
        creates a threadpool with receivers.size() threads, to send receivers.size() messages in a concurrent way. Then stops the threadpool to forbid the send of more messages in current poool. To send messages uses the send(String, String, CriticalSectionRouter, long) method
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender's id in the system
        receivers - list of the receivers's id in the system
        router - to access the service where the receiver is allowed
        messageTimeStamp - the timestamp to store in the message, concretelly the sender's lamport time

      • await

        public void await()
        waits for the response of all messages

      • send

        public void send(java.lang.String sender,
                 java.lang.String receiver,
                 CriticalSectionRouter router,
                 long messageTimeStamp)
        send one critical section access request from sender to receiver.
        Parameters:
        sender - the sender's id in the system
        receiver - the receivers's id in the system
        router - to access the service where the receiver is allowed
        messageTimeStamp - the timestamp to store in the message, concretelly the sender's lamport time
        See Also:
        CriticalSectionService.request(String, String, long)
